q16.question: Where does Cukrowicz bring Catherine?
q16.recall: Cukrowicz brings Catherine to the Venable estate in a last-ditch effort to help her, where he administers a truth serum that will allow her to overcome any resistance to remembering the details of what happened that summer.
q16.vectordb: Cukrowicz brings Catherine to the Venable estate for a truth serum session in front of an audience consisting of her aunt, mother, brother, Miss Foxhill, Dr. Hockstader, and Nurse Benson. During the session, Catherine recalls how she and Sebastian spent their days on the beach in the Spanish town of Cabeza de Lobo at a posh resort hotel on the beach. She remembers how Sebastian used her as bait to attract local teenage boys in order to proposition them for sex. The flashback ends with Catherine witnessing the starving street teens literally tearing Sebastian apart and eating his flesh. After the session, Catherine collapses upon the ground, sobbing, and then runs outside the house. Mrs. Venable closes Sebastian's book of poems, the pages of which are blank, and takes Cukrowicz's arm, calling him Sebastian. She tells him not to be out in the sun for too long and that they should go inside the boat and inform the captain that they want to leave. Cukrowicz returns to check on Catherine, who has recovered, having learned the truth. They both walk into the house together.
q16.hybrid: Cukrowicz brings Catherine to the Venable estate in a last-ditch effort to help her, where he administers a truth serum that will allow her to overcome any resistance to remembering the details of what happened that summer.
